MatchedRegions.transcript: For modern drug discovery, a commonly used approach is structure-based drug design.
And a key problem in structure-based drug design is to predict whether a candidate drug molecule will bind to the target protein and how it will bind.

MatchedRegion.Text: Structure-based drug design (SBDD) is a well-adopted approach for modern drug discovery. A key problem in SBDD is to predict whether a candidate drug molecule will bind to the target protein, and how. The structures of proteins and drug molecules are measured in unit of Angstrom (0.1 nm, 10-10 m). This extremely small length scale makes the prediction of protein-drug interaction a very challenging task.

MatchedRegions.transcript: This is an extremely challenging problem because the structure of proteins and drug molecules are measured in unit of Armstrong, 0.1 nanometer.

MatchedRegions.transcript: They are so small that are invisible to the naked eyes.
Sophisticated experiments have to be built to determine their structures and to study their dynamics is even harder.
